header_summary: One email discusses the need for `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` in a specific context to allow flexibility in spending transactions. There is a suggestion to generate a single public key known by all participants, but concerns about security are raised. The challenge of bonding funds to each participant is highlighted. Another email reviews wallets supporting descriptors and suggests using a different derivation path. The issue of reusing public keys within a Miniscript is addressed. Client-side validation projects are mentioned. Feedback on a proposal regarding user classification and protocol design is provided, questioning the scalability dimensions considered. The difficulty of coordinating casual users and the guarantee of timely on-chain transactions are raised as concerns.

recent_posts.title: Actuarial System To Reduce Interactivity In N-of-N (N > 2) Multiparticipant Offchain Mechanisms
recent_posts.summary:
- Loose interactivity and the need for `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` in a specific context.
- `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` allows transactions to spend either the next state or current state plus additional transactions.
- Participants suggest a single public key approach, but it raises concerns.

recent_posts.title: New BIP to align descriptors, xpub derivation and miniscript
recent_posts.summary:
- Some wallets supporting descriptors maintain vague BIP44 compatibility, but the derivation path doesn't commit to specific output types.
- BIP44 compatibility is kept in certain wallets for non-descriptor compatibility and user confirmation restrictions.
- Reusing public keys within a Miniscript is possible by deriving different hardened xpubs or appending unhardened derivation steps.

recent_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
recent_posts.summary:
- The proposal discusses the classification of users and designing protocols accordingly.
- The email raises concerns about scalability, group coordination, routing, and fault-tolerance in off-chain constructions.
- There are questions regarding the creation of a large number of Lightning channels and guaranteeing future transactions.

recent_posts.title: Sidepools For Improving Payment Reliability At Scale
recent_posts.summary:
- The sender discusses the challenges of predicting liquidity allocation on the Lightning Network.
- They propose the concept of sidepools to manage funds without closing channels.
- Sidepools help maintain liquidity, preserve privacy, and mitigate risks of doubling down on counterparties.

recent_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine questions the classification of users as "casual" or "dedicated" due to nuanced trust assumptions.
- He suggests introducing different scaling notions and questions the focus on onboarding scalability.
- Antoine raises concerns about group coordination, jamming, on-chain transactions, and fault-tolerance.

recent_posts.title: CLBOSS v0.13 aka "Born to Run" Release
recent_posts.summary:
- CLBOSS is now compliant with modern CLN versions, revitalizing the project.
- The release expresses gratitude to Ken for reviving the project and marks a milestone.
- More information about CLBOSS and its features can be found at the provided link.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- A blinded statechains implementation of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 is being implemented.
- The server will not have access to aggregate public key, aggregate signature, or signed message.
- The protocol involves key and nonce aggregation, with client-side verification of signatures.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- Blockchain storage is sufficient based on factors like block size and block time.
- A 5TB hard drive costing less than $150 can store blockchain data for 21 years.
- Optimization efforts and decreasing hardware costs reduce the burden of storage costs.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The proposal includes replacing OP_CHECK{IN, OUT}CONTRACTVERIFY with a single opcode, OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY (CCV).
- The new opcode, along with OP_CAT, achieves the full generality of MATT.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed.
- It addresses issues with channel backups and provides a solution for fraud proofs.
- The proposal suggests saving bandwidth by not sending all channel state information with every commitment.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard is proposing to organize the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- The announcement of CoreDev or LN Summit is usually not made on open communication channels.
- Antoine invites objections or feedback regarding his involvement in organizing the LN Summit 2024.

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary: - Bastien has submitted a pull request to the bLIPs repository to document a concept - The concept involves using an HSM as a whitelisted lightning peer to securely send commands to a lightning node - Bastien offers to provide specifications and review the implementation, suggesting it can be done under an open-source grant.
